description:
%description

Command Line Install

To install the feature from the command line, type:
bin/installUtility install com.ibm.websphere.appserver.anno-1.0
If you are installing into 8.5.5.5 or earlier and the feature supports that version, use the featureManager command, for example:
bin/featureManager install com.ibm.websphere.appserver.anno-1.0 --when-file-exists=ignore
name: com.ibm.websphere.appserver.anno-1.0

javaSEVersionRequirements.versionDisplayString: Java SE 6, Java SE 7, Java SE 8

description:
This feature enables support for the Java Architecture for XML Binding 2.2 specification, which provides easy mapping of Java classes to XML documents.

Command Line Install

To install the feature from the command line, type:
bin/installUtility install jaxb-2.2
If you are installing into 8.5.5.5 or earlier and the feature supports that version, use the featureManager command, for example:
bin/featureManager install jaxb-2.2 --when-file-exists=ignore

Config Instructions

To use the feature at runtime add the following to your server.xml file
<featureManager>
  <feature>jaxb-2.2</feature>
</featureManager>

Additional Information

  • For the complete feature documentation, see the jaxb-2.2 feature description in IBM Knowledge Center.
  • For more detailed installation instructions, including using Installation Manager and WebSphere Developer Tools, see Installing Liberty Repository assets in IBM Knowledge Center.
  • For offline installation from a directory-based repository using 8.5.5.8 or higher, see Installing assets using the installUtility command in IBM Knowledge Center.
  • For system requirements, see WebSphere Application Server detailed system requirements. Select the appropriate release, and click WebSphere Application Server (all editions). Select the edition, and choose the offering you want in Requirements by component.
name: Java XML Bindings 2.2
shortDescription: This feature enables support for the Java Architecture for XML Binding 2.2 specification, which provides easy mapping of Java classes to XML documents.
